scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety.
scenes.description: One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.'

options.text: I understand this seems overwhelming, but let's break it down into smaller tasks and tackle them one by one.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's feelings and proposed a practical solution, demonstrating empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's tough, but if we all pull together and stay focused, we can make it happen.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: Let's take a short break and come back with a fresh perspective. We can discuss how to distribute the workload more effectively.
options.analysis: You suggested taking a break to reduce stress and offered to reorganize the workload, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.
